content:
ICS 269, Fall 1997: Theory Seminar

The theory group meets Fridays at 1:00 in the CS 432/438 conference room.
This quarter's schedule:

3 Oct: David Eppstein: Quadrilateral meshing by circle packing
17 Oct: Mac Casale: Two dimensional set membership classification revisited: winding number versus ray firing
24 Oct: David Eppstein: Report from FOCS '97
31 Oct: Halloween
7 Nov: Thuan Do: Scheduling aperiodic and sporadic tasks in hard real-time systems
14 Nov: Joseph Wang: Better bounds for online scheduling
21 Nov: Brad Hutchings: Approximate minimum weight triangulation of convex polygons
28 Nov: Thanksgiving
5 Dec: Dan Halem: The computational complexity of knot and link problems

Other quarters' theory seminars

David Eppstein, Theory Group, Dept. Information & Computer Science, UC Irvine.
